xep.header:
Push Notifications: Priority This specification defines XMPP protocol extension allowing XMPP clients to inform XMPP server that it SHOULD mark published push notifications as high priority if they contain information REQUIRED to be shown to the XMPP client's user. &LEGALNOTICE; xxxx ProtoXEP Standards Track Standards Council
XMPP Core XEP-0001 XEP-0030 XEP-0357
NOT_YET_ASSIGNED
Andrzej Wójcik andrzej.wojcik@tigase.net andrzej.wojcik@tigase.org
0.0.1 2020-01-10 aw
First draft.

section1.p: &xep0357; defines a way for the XMPP server to generate push notifications by publishing them to the XMPP Push Services. However, that extension does not specify any rules for generating push notifications.
This extension was created to provide a way for XMPP Client to inform sever that it wants to know the priority of sent push notifications.
The XMPP server MUST support &xep0357; as this specification is the extension to push notifications.

Before enabling this feature, a client SHOULD determine whether the user’s server supports marking push notifications as high priority; to do so, it MUST send a Service Discovery (XEP-0030) [2] information query to the user’s bare JID:

example.caption: Client queries server regarding protocol support

section1.p: If the user's server supports marking push notifications priority, it MUST include a feature 'urn:xmpp:push:priority:0'.
section1.example: <iq from='juliet@capulet.lit' to='juliet@capulet.lit/balcony' id='disco1' type='result'> <query xmlns='http://jabber.org/protocol/disco#info'> <identity category='account' type='registered'/> <feature var='urn:xmpp:push:priority:0'/> ... </query> </iq>

section1.p: To enable this feature XMPP client sends IQ-set with an element containing element qualified by the 'urn:push:priority:0' namespace:
section1.example: <iq type='set' id='x42'> <enable xmlns='urn:xmpp:push:0' jid='push-5.client.example' node='yxs32uqsflafdk3iuqo' > <priority xmlns='urn:xmpp:push:priority:0' /> </enable> </iq>
section1.p: Note: The XMPP client SHOULD enable this feature ONLY if the XMPP server supports all required push notifications filtering.

If this feature is enabled and high priority push notification is being sent, the XMPP Server MUST indicate this by adding to the element a element qualified by the 'urn:xmpp:push:priority:0' namespace with it's value set to 'high':
section1.example: <iq type='set' from='example.com' to='push-5.client.example' id='n12'> <pubsub xmlns='http://jabber.org/protocol/pubsub'> <publish node='yxs32uqsflafdk3iuqo'> <item> <notification xmlns='urn:xmpp:push:0'> <x xmlns='jabber:x:data'> <field var='FORM_TYPE'><value>urn:xmpp:push:summary</value></field> <field var='message-count'><value>1</value></field> <field var='last-message-sender'><value>juliet@capulet.example/balcony</value></field> <field var='last-message-body'><value>Wherefore art thou, Romeo?</value></field> </x> <priority xmlns='urn:xmpp:push:priority:0'>high</priority> </notification> </item> </publish> </pubsub> </iq>

section1.p: User's server, with this feature enabled, SHOULD mark all push notifications with 'priority' element which MUST have a value of either 'high' or 'low'.
'high' value MUST only be used when data triggering notification will require notifying XMPP Client's user, ie. incoming message with a body, incoming VoIP call.

Before applying priority to push notification, user's server MUST properly estimate priority of the notification using data available in the stanza or available to the user's server such as notifications filtering mechanisms.
If properly implemented, this protocol extension does not introduce any new security concerns above and beyond those defined in RFC 6120 and RFC 6121.
This document requires no interaction with &IANA;.

section2.p: The ®ISTRAR; includes 'urn:xmpp:push:priority:0' in its registry of protocol namespaces (see &NAMESPACES;).

section1.p: Alternatively to the approach described in this document, it was considered to determine priority of push notification based on existence of &xep0004; of 'FORM_TYPE' equal 'urn:xmpp:push:summary' within 'notification' element defined in &xep0357;. That approach however was not normative as &xep0357; suggests usage of this data form element, but only if summarized information is to be provided. That could lead to assuming that some of high priority notifications are actually a low priority once.
